translation.en: [narrator] On July 10th, 1943,
a unit from Oklahoma,
translation.ja: オクラホマ州兵にはメキシコ系アメリカ人や

translation.en: composed of Mexican-Americans, Native Americans and Dust Bowl cowboys,
translation.ja: オクラホマ州兵にはメキシコ系アメリカ人や アメリカ先住民中西部のカウボーイがいた

translation.en: most of whom couldn't drink together in the same bars back home,
translation.ja: 故郷では同じバーで飲めない者が隊を成し

translation.en: landed in Sicily and began a brutal 500-day trek through Nazi-occupied Europe.
translation.ja: シチリアに上陸 ナチスと500日に及ぶ激戦を繰り広げた

translation.en: This is the story of those men.
translation.ja: これは その男たちの物語だ

translation.en: A group of soldiers known…
translation.ja: 彼らは こう呼ばれた

translation.en: as the Thunderbirds.
How the hell can Coldfoot see anything? I can't even see my fuckin' boots.
translation.ja: コールドフットはよく先が見えるな

translation.en: -What's he lookin' at? -He's looking at the fog.
translation.ja: 何を見てる？ 霧だよ

translation.en: The fog? What the fuck does that mean? We can all see the fog.
translation.ja: それは全員に見えてる

translation.en: Shut up, Spigs. Just make sure you can see him.
translation.ja: 静かに　スピッグス彼を見失うな

translation.en: Yes, sir, Captain.
-[soldier] Get down! -[gunfire]
-Spigs, get down! -I'm tryin'! Ah! Shit! I'm hit. Fuck!
translation.ja: スピッグス 伏せろ 撃たれた　チクショウ！

translation.en: Oh, fuck.
Two Panzers, four platoons of infantry, 500 yards ahead.
translation.ja: 前方450メートルに戦車２台 小隊４つ

translation.en: Fall back to that ridge.
E Company, fall back!
Incoming coordinates.
-2-6… -[shouting continues]
Nagles, shut up!
All right. Let's go, Nagles, come on!
translation.ja: よし ネイグル　行くぞ

translation.en: No, no, no! Don't go under the trees. Stay out in the open!
translation.ja: ダメだ　木の下はマズい外にいろ

translation.en: Thanks, Cap.
Garcia, Rosa, check out that barn.
translation.ja: １９４３年９月イタリア　サレルノガルシア　ロザ納屋を調べろ ガルシア　ロザ納屋を調べろ

translation.en: They fell back two miles south and they're still moving.
What's our damage?
Six dead or missing. At least ten wounded.
I wanna know where the Germans are sleeping tonight.
Look out for booby traps.
Watch your feet.
Shit! What was that?
A rat?
Nah, man.
Too big.
Must be a dog.
He was hiding in the barn, sir. He won't shut up.
We need Spigs to tell us what the hell he's saying.
Found this in his hiding place.
[in Italian] Give me it. Give me it.
Give me it. Give me it.
All right, get him inside. Get some food in him.
Where the hell is Spigs?
[man] Spigliani. -[in Italian] Do you speak Italian? -Yes.
translation.ja: スピリアニ〈イタリア語は話すか？〉

translation.en: -[slowly] Charlestown, Massachusetts. -[Spigs chuckles]
translation.ja: “チャールストンマサチューセッツ…”

translation.en: Yes.
-[in English] But you know Boston? -Mh-hmm.
[in Italian] Yes.
[in English] Boston.
[in Boston accent] Park the car in Harvard Yard.
translation.ja: ハーバード･ヤードの駐車場

translation.en: Fenway Park.
Paul Revere.
Where did you learn to swim, Private Spigliani?
-Swim? -No, let me guess. The boys' club on 2nd Street.
translation.ja: 当てよう２番通りのボーイズ･クラブ

translation.en: Yeah.
How the hell do you know that?
I told you.
I was a graduate student at MIT.
translation.ja: 私はＭＩＴ(工科大)の卒業生だ

translation.en: I lived on Maple, near the intersection of 4th.
translation.ja: 住所は４号線との交差点にあるメープル

translation.en: And I dated a girl… named Hammel…
translation.ja: 当時の恋人の名前はハメル…

translation.en: Gloria.
She had these…
beautiful breasts.
Sparky Hammel's sister, yeah.
[laughing] Damn!
You and me in Charlestown at the boys' club.
translation.ja: 君はチャールズタウンで同じクラブにいた

translation.en: -It's a small world, isn't it? -You can say that again.
translation.ja: 世間は狭いよな まったくだ

translation.en: Akacheta.
Carmona.
Kawacatoose.
Indians and Mexicans
translation.ja: アメリカ先住民にメキシコ人…

translation.en: and a wop from Boston?
Yeah. 157th Regiment from Oklahoma.
translation.ja: オクラホマの第157歩兵連隊だ

translation.en: I got attached at Salerno as an interpreter.
translation.ja: サレルノで通訳についた

translation.en: And their leader, he is an Indian, too?
Capt. Sparks? No.
He's a cowboy. From Arizona.
translation.ja: アリゾナ出身の白人だ

translation.en: Things must be getting desperate in America if they're allowing these types into your army.
translation.ja: アメリカは必死だなこんな連中を雇うとは

translation.en: Red men and Mexicans. Inferior races.
We don't see 'em that way.
They're Americans. Like me.
translation.ja: アメリカ人だ　僕と同じ

translation.en: Really?
I've been to Oklahoma, Corporal,
translation.ja: オクラホマのバーには

translation.en: and the bars have signs out front that say… "No Indians Allowed. No Mexicans."
translation.ja: 先住民やメキシコ人立入禁止の看板があった

translation.en: I've also been to Georgia.
They make their Negroes there drink from separate water fountains.
translation.ja: 黒人と白人の飲み水を分けていた

translation.en: So don't tell me they're Americans just like you.
Strange.
To fight for a country where you can't even enjoy a beer… at the same bar as your fellow soldier.
translation.ja: 同志とビールを飲めない国のために戦うなんてね

translation.en: So… please now tell me about the ponds.
translation.ja: では ポンズのことを話してもらおう

translation.en: Ponds?
Yes, I need to know what you did about the ponds.
translation.ja: そうだ　ポンズに何をした？

translation.en: What ponds? I don't know what the hell you're talking about.
translation.ja: どの池？　何のことか…

translation.en: -Jesus Christ! -Ponds!
-What did you do with the ponds! -We didn't see any fucking ponds.
translation.ja: 何をしたんだ 見てない

translation.en: -You're lying! -Jesus Christ, I'm telling you the truth.
translation.ja: ウソつけ 本当だよ

translation.en: Your company crossed three ponds in two days.
Here, here and here.
translation.ja: ここと ここと ここだ

translation.en: What are the conditions of those ponds?
translation.ja: これらのポンズの状態は？

translation.en: Ponte. Br-- Bridges. You're talking about bridges.
translation.ja: ポンテス！　橋のことか？

translation.en: Yes.
Bridges.
I used the Italian word, didn't I? My mistake.
translation.ja: ついイタリア語が出たすまない

translation.en: Jesus Christ.
What are the conditions of those bridges?
We didn't touch the bridges. They're all there.
translation.ja: 何もしてない　まだ ある

translation.en: Relax, Spigliani.
The war for you is over. You may even get to enjoy swimming in Charlestown again.
translation.ja: お前の戦争は終わった故郷で泳ぎを楽しめ

translation.en: But by this time tomorrow, your cowboy and Indian friends will all be dead.
translation.ja: だが明日の今頃お前の隊は全滅してる

translation.en: Hey, Captain.
The kid's looking at the photos on your gun.
My family.
[in Italian] Family. Do you understand?
[in English] Where's yours?
-Jesus. Does anybody here speak Italian? -Yeah.
translation.ja: 誰か通訳しろ 俺は少し話せます

translation.en: Yeah, I know a little.
Antonio.
-He says his name is… -[chuckles]
We, uh, we got that part.
[in English] He says his, um, mother and father died.
He's been living here with his grandfather. Till he died.
translation.ja: 祖父が死ぬまでは２人暮らし

translation.en: He's been hiding from the Germans for the last month.
We lost them, sir. They're using the rain to screen their movements.
translation.ja: 見失いました雨を隠れ蓑(みの)にされた

translation.en: Ask him if he knows where the Germans are.
He says he doesn't know.
He's lying.
Well, he's scared as shit, man.
-Jesus, Gomez, what did you do to him? -I didn't do anything.
translation.ja: ゴメス 何した？ 何もしてねえ

translation.en: -[laughing] -What the hell's so funny?
Ah, the Germans, man. They told him that first we were gonna feed him and then we were gonna do it to him.
translation.ja: ドイツ兵から“米兵が切る”と聞いたとさ

translation.en: Do what?
Cut off his nuts.
Hey, man, tell him we're not interested.
translation.ja: もう要らないと言ってやれ

translation.en: -Tell him we already bagged our limit. -Tell him they're too small.
translation.ja: 袋一杯に持ってる 小さすぎる

translation.en: Tell him it's a lie.
Tell him the Germans aren't coming back. We guarantee it.
translation.ja: ドイツ兵は もう来ない俺たちが保証する

translation.en: Sir, are you sure you want me to tell him that?
translation.ja: 本当に そう伝えますか？

translation.en: Tell him those men…
are the grandsons of the greatest Indian warriors to roam the American Plains.
translation.ja: アメリカ先住民の偉大な戦士の孫だ

translation.en: They've killed mountain lion, hunted buffalo.
translation.ja: ピューマやバッファローを狩った

translation.en: Tell him those men…
they're the descendants of the powerful Mexican army that defeated the French on Cinco de Mayo.
translation.ja: フランス軍を撃退した強いメキシコ軍の子孫

translation.en: And those men…
they're sons of Texas Rangers…
who brought the rule of law to places where only killers and thieves lived before.
translation.ja: 殺人犯や強盗を相手に治安を守った

translation.en: Tell him the Nazis are never gonna hurt him again.
translation.ja: ナチスは もう来ない

translation.en: Because tomorrow, we're gonna find 'em and stop 'em.
There now. Doesn't that feel better?
translation.ja: どうだ　安心したろ？

translation.en: No man should have to walk around covering his privates.
translation.ja: もう股を隠さずに済む

translation.en: He actually made the kid believe we could do it.
Wasn't the kid he was convincing.
[Gomez] Sir?
A gift from our young friend.
It was his grandfather's. He wants you to have it.
translation.ja: 祖父の物を あなたにと

translation.en: I cut down the barrel to make it more practical.
translation.ja: 銃身を切っておきました

translation.en: He also told me where the Germans are.
-Be safe out there. -See ya, kid.
translation.ja: 気を付けて またな

translation.en: [in Italian] Thank you.
You're welcome.
Watch the grass in the middle.
[Sparks] It's not movin'.
Tank.
Panzer, two o'clock, 50 yards.
Let's go!
Come on!
Medic!
Get the Jeep.
Captain's been hit.
translation.ja: 大尉が撃たれた　病院へ

translation.en: -We need to take him to a field hospital. -Hold this.
translation.ja: 大尉が撃たれた　病院へ 押さえろ

translation.en: Gomez?
[in Spanish] Hurry!
[in English] All right. Hang in there. Hang in there. Stay still. Come on!
translation.ja: 頑張れ 動かないで　しっかり！

translation.en: -Get him outta here. Now! -Here we go. Come on. Get him up.
translation.ja: すぐ連れてけ ほら 持ち上げるぞ

translation.en: Easy. Easy.
Keep that up.
[Coldfoot] Stop!
Go! Go!
At ease, Lieutenant.
It's not Honolulu, is it?
translation.ja: ホノルルとは違うだろ

translation.en: Honolulu's overrated, sir.
Really?
Don't spoil my fantasy.
Finished a stint in Hawaii, then three years of college. Why'd you re-enlist?
translation.ja: ハワイで退役して大学で３年… なぜまた？

translation.en: I ran out of money, sir.
Give the Army another couple of years, then go back and graduate.
translation.ja: ２年 軍で稼いで大学に戻って卒業か

translation.en: That's the plan, sir.
You did hear there might be a war on the horizon?
translation.ja: 戦争の うわさは聞いたか？

translation.en: I caught wind of that, yes, sir.
If that happens, we're gonna need every good officer we can get our hands on.
translation.ja: そうなれば優秀な士官は戦場へ送る

translation.en: If that happens, I intend to be one of them, sir.
What got you in the Army in the first place?
A sandwich, sir.
I had to leave home when I was 17.
Hunted all over the west for work,
ended up skinny and starving in San Francisco.
translation.ja: 西部で仕事にあぶれ サンフランシスコで飢えていた

translation.en: Army recruiter bought me a meal, said that if I signed up, I'd get three just like it every day.
translation.ja: 陸軍のスカウトが軍に入れば１日３度食えると

translation.en: Your previous CO said you're good at handling problems.
translation.ja: 問題解決が得意と聞いた

translation.en: Well, I've got one. One of my companies, J Company, has failed every live fire test for the past three months.
translation.ja: Ｊ中隊は過去３ヵ月射撃テストに失敗している

translation.en: -Do you think you can shape them up? -Yes, sir.
translation.ja: 訓練できるか？ はい

translation.en: Good.
You've got one week.
Hey.
-I'm looking for J Company. -Uh, over there.
[Gomez] Turn off that fucking gringo music.
translation.ja: 止めろよ　耳障りだ

translation.en: -[music stops] -As you were, Corporal. Who's in charge here?
translation.ja: 君は伍長だな　責任者は？

translation.en: -Um, Lt. Danalli, sir. -Lt. Danalli is now relieved.
translation.ja: デナーリ 交替になった

translation.en: My name is Sparks. I want a list of all prisoners and charges.
translation.ja: スパークスだ囚人のリストが欲しい

translation.en: Uh, right away, sir.
Follow me, sir.
Cordosa.
Drunk and disorderly.
Red Feather.
Assault and battery.
Gomez.
Assaulting an officer.
Hallowell.
Assaulting an officer.
We get a lot of that in here.
Why are the men segregated?
The Indians and the Mexicans don't like each other much.
translation.ja: 先住民とメキシコ人は不仲で

translation.en: And they both hate us more.
translation.ja: どちらも私たちを嫌う

translation.en: Open the doors.
Sir?
Open the doors, Corporal.
Cordosa, Miguel.
Clovis, New Mexico. There's a river down there, the Caheesh.
translation.ja: ニューメキシコのクローヴィスか　川がある

translation.en: Fishing any good?
[in Spanish] Of course.
What's that?
[in English] Gila trout. It's the best in the world.
translation.ja: ヒラマス　世界一うまい

translation.en: Hallowell.
Wilsall, Montana. Sheep country.
translation.ja: ウィルサルか　羊がいる

translation.en: What do you do about the wolves?
We shoot 'em.
You any good at that?
I never miss.
Gomez.
Who the hell gave you that?
My brother.
Shit, I don't want you. I want him.
Coldfoot.
Private Samuel Coldfoot.
translation.ja: コールドフット二等兵

translation.en: My name is Lt. Sparks.
The fact that I'm talking to you in a jailhouse tells me you didn't get on well with your previous COs.
translation.ja: 前の上長とは相性が悪かったようだな

translation.en: Maybe you were told you're too stupid for this army.
Maybe you were told you got a problem with authority or…
maybe…
you were told you come from a race… that's got no business wearing the uniform.
translation.ja: 人種のせいで軍人扱いされなかったか

translation.en: Whatever you've been told doesn't mean shit to me.
What matters to me… is performance.
translation.ja: 俺が重視するのは実力だ

translation.en: There's a live fire test at the end of the week. Pass it…
translation.ja: 金曜に射撃の試験がある合格すれば―

translation.en: and you can enjoy a weekend of freedom.
Forty-eight hours, not only outside this cage… but off-post.
translation.ja: 48時間 独房どころか基地の外で過ごせる

translation.en: But…
like everything else in life…
this privilege must be earned.
translation.ja: それには努力が必要だ

translation.en: Now, if you feel that you and the US Army have reached the end of your journey together,
translation.ja: 君たちが米軍と運命を共にする気があるなら

translation.en: do not waste my time.
Or anybody else's.
But if you want the chance to prove that everything that every asshole ever said about you is wrong…
translation.ja: 自分を侮辱したクソどもを見返したいなら

translation.en: you got two minutes to lace up and join me outside.
Shall we give them another minute, sir?
No.
It doesn't take another minute to figure this out.
Lock 'em back up.
Who's missing?
Only Coldfoot, sir.
All right, Corporal.
-Line 'em up. -Were you bullshitting me
translation.ja: 伍長　整列させろ 本当に外に出られるのか？

translation.en: or can you really get us off-post?
translation.ja: 本当に外に出られるのか？

translation.en: Only if the whole group passes.
[Sparks] J Company, attention!
[Sparks] Marks.
Sir?
-What's the story with Coldfoot? -What story, sir?
translation.ja: コールドフットだが 何か？

translation.en: He's been in the Army over three years. Why is he still a private?
translation.ja: ３年務めてなぜ二等兵なんだ

translation.en: Coldfoot got demoted, sir.
He used to be corporal. Up for a promotion to sergeant.
translation.ja: 元は軍曹候補の伍長でした

translation.en: What happened?
He got turned down. He blamed some NCOs, and it ended in a big fight.
translation.ja: 昇格を白紙にした士官と大ゲンカになって…

translation.en: The colonel… busted him down to private.
translation.ja: 大佐が二等兵に降格を

translation.en: He got in a fight because he was denied promotion?
It was his third rejection, sir.
Coldfoot is an Indian with pride, Lieutenant.
translation.ja: 彼は誇り高き先住民です

translation.en: It's… it's not a very "healthy combination around here.
translation.ja: ここでは毛嫌いされる

translation.en: [master sergeant] No wonder you feather-heads lost all your land.
translation.ja: インディアンが領土を失ったのもムリはない

translation.en: Here I thought it was 'cause you couldn't hold your liquor.
translation.ja: 酔っ払いだからかと思っていたが

translation.en: But all this time, it was 'cause you couldn't shoot worth a fuck.
translation.ja: 銃すら まともに撃てないせいらしい

translation.en: What mojado taught you to fire a gun, Gomez?
translation.ja: 遊女にでも射撃を教わったか ゴメス

translation.en: Was it your melon-pickin' mother?
You got a problem with something, boy?
Well…
will you look who's back, boys?
translation.ja: 戻ってきた奴がいるぞ

translation.en: It's Corporal… [chuckles] …I mean, Private Chillyfoot.
translation.ja: 伍長…　いやコールドフット二等兵

translation.en: I thought we got rid of you, prairie nigger.
translation.ja: 出戻ったか　インディアン

translation.en: Trust me, it is just a matter of time--
translation.ja: 保証するぜ　遅かれ早かれ…

translation.en: Master Sergeant, can my men get a little more of your instruction and a little less of your commentary?
translation.ja: 曹長　私語は減らして指導を増やしてくれ

translation.en: Beggin' your pardon, sir. I forgot you're new around here.
translation.ja: 失礼ですが あなたはここでは新顔でしたね

translation.en: See, this here is my firing range.
translation.ja: いいですかここは私の射撃場だ

translation.en: That means when your men step onto my range,
translation.ja: 例え あなたの部下でもここに いる時は

translation.en: they become my men.
That's funny, Sergeant, 'cause the way I see it is…
translation.ja: それは おかしいな

translation.en: when I bring my men onto your range…
translation.ja: 俺の部下が ここにいる時は

translation.en: you become their instructor.
translation.ja: あなたは講師になるはず

translation.en: So far, all they've gotten from you is a dissertation on their diets and the sexual habits of their mothers, so…
translation.ja: ところが彼らの食文化や母親への侮辱ばかりだ

translation.en: how about doing a little work?
See, now,
where I come from,
a man don't toss words around like that…
translation.ja: 男が そうやってくっちゃべる時は

translation.en: unless he's willing to back them up.
translation.ja: 言葉に責任を取る時だけだ

translation.en: What goes on behind that shed stays behind that shed.
translation.ja: 小屋の裏で起きることは口外無用だぜ

translation.en: Very well, Sergeant.
Lead on.
You'd better start thinking how you're gonna explain these bruises, sir.
translation.ja: 傷の言い訳を考えておいた方がいい

translation.en: What bruises?
Fair warning, boys. You go back there, you'll have company.
translation.ja: 行けば一緒に殴られる

translation.en: He still alive?
Barely.
Good.
I was wondering how I was gonna explain that.
Shall we pick up where we left off, gentlemen?
Attention!
Good work, Lieutenant.
-Best scores of any group. -Thank you, sir.
We credit the master sergeant with our success.
translation.ja: ありがとうございます曹長のおかげです

translation.en: Excellent work, Master Sergeant. Sorry to hear about your little accident.
translation.ja: よくやったな事故は気の毒だった

translation.en: -Bring in the next group. -Yes, sir.
Come in.
There's a problem with Coldfoot. He's going into town.
translation.ja: コールドフットが町へ

translation.en: -Yeah, he's got a pass. -It's where he's going that's a problem.
translation.ja: 合格したからな 場所が悪い

translation.en: [Sparks] Whatever you're planning…
translation.ja: 〝インディアン 禁止〞 何をする気だ

translation.en: don't.
They'll only call the MPs, have you thrown in jail. What'll that prove?
translation.ja: 憲兵に捕まるぞそれで何が変わる？

translation.en: That nothing in this army leads to anything good.
That's not true. What if I told you I'd put you up for sergeant this week?
translation.ja: それは違う俺が軍曹に昇格させたら？

translation.en: No offense, Lieutenant, but I've been up for sergeant before.
You wait and wait and then they give you an excuse and tell you no.
translation.ja: いくら待っても却下だ

translation.en: -I ain't waiting anymore. -You don't have to.
translation.ja: 待てない 大丈夫だ

translation.en: Get in the car, Sergeant Coldfoot.
[doctor] Is that your wife, Captain?
Yeah.
Lucky man.
On a lot of fronts.
The shrapnel went through your abdomen and sliced open your liver.
translation.ja: 榴(りゅう)散弾で肝臓が裂かれた

translation.en: -You wanna tell me what the lucky part is? -You should be dead.
translation.ja: どこがラッキー？ 死ぬところだ

translation.en: Quick action by your men saved your life.
If you ever see them again, I suggest taking them out for a steak dinner.
translation.ja: 会えたらステーキでも おごれ

translation.en: Speaking of seeing them… when do I go back to Italy?
translation.ja: 部下に会えるイタリアにはいつ戻れる？

translation.en: Maybe after the war.
Your combat days are over, Captain. Next stop for you is home.
translation.ja: 君の戦いは終わったアメリカへ帰れ

translation.en: Congratulations, Captain. You've got a million-dollar wound.
translation.ja: おめでとう100万ドルの傷ね

translation.en: [narrator on newsreel] Italy,1944.
With winter setting in, the fighting south of Rome continues.
translation.ja: 冬に入ってもローマ以南での戦いは続き―

translation.en: Allied troops are dug in, waiting for the next German counterattack, which is expected any day.
translation.ja: 連合国軍は地下で敵の反撃を待ち構える日々です

translation.en: The going is tough, but so are our boys.
translation.ja: 苦境にあっても米兵はタフだ

translation.en: Ask any one of them and they'll tell you
it'll take a lot more than a little rain and mud to get these GI Joes down.
translation.ja: “こんな小雨程度でＧＩジョーは死なない”

translation.en: I need transportation, Captain. I'm not that damn particular. You'll do.
translation.ja: 車を出してくれ 大尉君でも構わん

translation.en: Okay, now that you've seen it…
I'm thirsty. Let's get a drink.
It happened a week after you were wounded. My Jeep hit a mine.
translation.ja: 君が負傷した１週間後ジープで地雷を踏んだ

translation.en: It threw me 20 feet in the air, took off everything below the knee.
translation.ja: 俺は６メートル宙を舞いひざ下を失った

translation.en: Congratulations on your stars, sir.
Thank you.
Truth is, Felix… in this war, getting promoted is easy.
translation.ja: だがな ここでは昇進するのは簡単だ

translation.en: The hard part is staying alive.
Any news on the 157?
They're stuck on the Gustav Line south of Cassino.
translation.ja: グスタフ･ラインで膠(こう)着状態だ

translation.en: It's cold, wet and shitty. They're hangin' tough.
translation.ja: 寒くて湿っぽい場所で踏ん張っている

translation.en: Who'd you send in for me?
Kettleman.
He's a good soldier.
translation.ja: あいつは いい兵士だ

translation.en: He's not you, but he's okay.
[sighs] When are they, uh, sending you home, sir?
translation.ja: あなたは いつ家へ？

translation.en: Next week.
I was going to offer to take any letters back for you, but I hear that won't be necessary.
translation.ja: でも君の手紙を持って帰る必要はなさそうだな

translation.en: You're right after me.
Yeah.
Don't act excited or anything.
I know this sounds crazy.
I feel I should be in Italy. I oughta be with my men.
Go home, Felix. Go home to Mary.
See your son, raise more babies.
translation.ja: 息子に会いもっと子を増やせ

translation.en: You've done your duty.
Safe travels, sir.
See you back home, Felix.
[Sparks] My dearest Mary…
I've never been a good letter writer, so I don't know if I can explain this.
translation.ja: 手紙は うまく書けたためしがないし

translation.en: Hell, I'm not sure I can explain it even to myself.
translation.ja: 説明できるか分からない

translation.en: When I left you to come over here, I was scared of losing you.
translation.ja: ここに来た時君を失うのが怖かった

translation.en: Scared of not coming back.
Scared of dying.
I'm not scared anymore.
[man] Sir?
There's an Army captain out there.
He wants to hitch a ride back to Italy.
translation.ja: イタリアへ戻りたいと

translation.en: [Sparks] I guess the only way to explain my decision is that it isn't my time to come home yet.
translation.ja: 今は まだ故郷に帰る時じゃない

translation.en: Captain, what are you doing?
What's it look like I'm doing, Doc?
You're not ready for discharge.
You walk out of here, Captain, you'll be AWOL.
-[Sparks] Take care, kid. -Captain!
[Sparks] I know you want me home. Make no mistake, I wanna be home.
translation.ja: 君は俺の帰りを待ってるだろう

translation.en: Desperately.
I wanna hold my son in my arms and lay with you on a quiet desert night beneath the stars.
translation.ja: 息子を抱きたいし君と星の下で眠りたいが

translation.en: But I owe something to a group of men.
Men who… before the war… I'd probably never have known,
translation.ja: 戦争がなければ出会うことのなかった仲間

translation.en: and now I know as well as I know myself.
translation.ja: 今は自分のことのように知っている

translation.en: If I came home, I could never live with myself, knowing I owed a debt to them and ignored it.
translation.ja: このまま帰国すれば俺は一生 後悔する

translation.en: So I have to complete this journey I've started.
translation.ja: 自分が始めた旅だから

translation.en: I cannot quit.
Anything less would leave a hole in my conscience that I could never repair.
translation.ja: 良心に穴が開けば二度と ふさがらない

translation.en: Capt. Sparks, 157th Regiment, 2nd Battalion.
translation.ja: 第157連隊スパークス大尉です

translation.en: Orders, Captain.
I was just released from a hospital in North Africa, sir. I was hoping to be reassigned to my old company.
translation.ja: 退院したばかりです前の隊に戻りたい

translation.en: What happened to your orders, Captain?
I didn't like 'em, sir. They were to send me home.
translation.ja: 拒否します　帰国命令でした

translation.en: Mary, I don't expect you to understand.
translation.ja: 理解しろとは言わない

translation.en: I'm having a hard time understanding it myself.
translation.ja: 俺自身が理解に苦しんだ

translation.en: But I have never been more sure of anything in my life and I have to trust that.
translation.ja: でも これ以上ないほど確信している

translation.en: So, please…
my darling Mary…
my dearest wife…
forgive me.
Get back to your foxhole, soldier. That's an order.
translation.ja: 穴に戻れ　これは命令だ

translation.en: Dios mio, it's the captain.
What are you looking at, Sergeant?
-[gun cocks] -Give me your report.
♪ Just before the sunrise ♪
translation.ja: 日本語字幕　藤原 千春

translation.en: ♪ Hearts are breaking All the way to hell ♪
translation.ja: 故マイケル･リンに捧ぐ(1941-2019)
